185993012.review:
Недурной экшен с сюжетом завязанным на перемещении во времени, временных петлях и всего в этом духе. Отснятые фрагменты "сериала" временами слишком затянуты, а наличие кат-сцен чрезмерно. От чего создается впечатление, что непосредственно сам игровой процесс задвинут на второй план. Однако, иногда, игре все же удается быть игрой и хоть и не без шероховатостей. Довольно средненький экшен - этакий урезанный Макс Пэйн, но подача сюжета делает "свое" дело. Вот ты начинаешь поддушиваться однообразными перестрелками, а тут "новая серия" подъехала. Или же обратная сторона - входишь во вкус, только распробовал всю эту движуху со способностями и пальбой, и...кат-сцена. Не хватает баланса между этими переходами. То в избытке одно, то в нехватке другое. И эти "американские" горки далеко не всем придутся по вкусу. И все-таки, в проекте есть что-то, какой-то определенный шарм. Если перестрелки скучноваты, то дело поправят короткометражки или кат-сцены. Можно найти то, что тебя удержит в игре еще на пару часов. Но, в случае, когда вам "не заходит" ни история, ни геймплей - вы вряд ли осилите данный продукт.
7 Хроно Развилок из 10

185893266.review:
First off, I really enjoy games such as Heavy Rain, Beyond Two Souls, Detroit: Become Human, therefore I assumed I would love Quantum Break. I bought this game when it first came out.

Finally, decided to give it a try. Boy am I glad. So far, after two acts, this game is even better than I initially anticipated. Graphics are incredible, story line is quite engaging, and the game play is very good, much more game play than the three previous titles I mentioned. 

I haven't yet visited the Alan Wake franchise or Control, but I plan on doing so once I finish this gem of a game.

If you enjoy any of the titles I have mentioned or are looking for something that offers a realistic feel, without it being overly complex but enough to feel the challenge, give this one a try. 

Right now, it's a solid 9/10 for me and I can't wait to see where the game brings me.

185462232.review:
Quantum Break is an interactive TV show at best. The story is quite good, but the gameplay not so much. 
I really enjoyed the prologue, then felt the games pace dropped off a cliff but it was still interesting enough to keep me going. 
The cutscenes are streamed to you, along with the full length episodes. 
The first episode I watched I was a bit confused as to why am I watching a 20 minute live action cutscene in my video game lol- but ah, overall the "game" was fun.
It has a fair few technical issues, such as hitreg problems, the A.I. being silly (I had a couple of enemies spinning like a spin bot just they weren't shooting). Some of the enemies appearances reminded me of CSGO, it almost looked like the same assets as CSGO CT's and T's. 
The acting was pretty dire at times but overall it was okay. 
Sometimes the cutscenes start buffering for whatever reason, and it wasn't a problem on my end. 
I'm not totally sure why they chose to make a game and not just keep it as a televised series or mini-series. 
I do recommend the game even though it has a fair few faults. I think I purchased this years ago as part of a Humble Bundle, or else I got it on sale for like 4 euro. Was worth to me anyway.

185444618.review: This is an interesting and fairly unique game with a good story and I enjoyed the cover shooting. I also liked the way the cut-scenes go into gameplay almost seamlessly, and the video sequences are fun to watch. However, it runs poorly, I had the occasional crash and most of the abilities went unused. Only used the upgrade system when I noticed a message about it on-screen in act 5. You barely need to use that side of the game. Oh, and if ever a game needed manual saves, this was it. It's a tough one to recommend unless deeply discounted and you're into the Control/Wake connections.

185430203.review:
Мне понравилась история, мне понравились актёры, мне понравилось как сценарные загадки расставленные в первой половине игры раскрываются во второй. Да, клубок этих загадок может показаться слишком простым, но мне кажется, это зависит от того как часто и с какой увлечённостью вы погружаетесь в произведения о путешествиях во времени. Отдельно хочется похвалить дизайнеров предпоследнего уровня, где десятки застывших в агонии солдат издают свой приглушённый предсмертный крик буквально вечность.

О спорных моментах:
- Гибридный формат интерактивного фильма с шутером от третьего лица и полноценным сериалом (которого почему-то нет в файлах игры и вы буквально смотрите его "онлайн", а связь с сервером может просто взять и оборваться). Никто не заставлял их следовать устарелой формуле чередования повествования и геймплея и в данном случае я считаю, что экшен-сцены в виде QTE как в условном Detroit: Become Human выглядели бы намного органичнее, хоть и существенно сократили бы продолжительность игры. 
- В игре много, очень много, просто неприлично много записок и переписок персонажей об происходящем и о друг-друге, но они практически не раскрывают их характеры и мотивации. Даже в конце игры вы не будете знать чем жил главный герой до событий игры и почему он мастерски владеет всевозможным огнестрелом. [spoiler]Бет[/spoiler] это вредит больше всего - её [spoiler] жертва и оковы обстоятельств формируют отличную драму,[/spoiler] но мы почти ничего не знаем о ней как о личности.
- Хотя графика и оптимизация в целом хороши, технически игра состарилась не лучшим образом - тени периодически мерцают, источники света тоже, качество отрисовки зависит не только от расстояния до персонажа но и от угла камеры. А самое нелепое с чем я столкнулся переигрывая некоторые уровни - ПРОПУСК коротких катсцен длится (загружается) ДОЛЬШЕ чем их ПРОСМОТР. И это при учёте установки на SSD.

Откровенным разочарованием нахожу только боёвку. В голове просто не укладывается что эти скучнейшие экшн-сцены сделаны Remedy. Утвердить! В качестве главных геймплейных секций! Посредственную стрельбу! Глупейших ботов! Мини-боссов убиваемых за 10! Секунд!!!

185412188.review:
TLDR: Plagued by being a product before its era, Quantum Break is a cinematic treat if you choose to get it running in 2025.

Pros:
- 2016 visuals make most new games look awful.  A weird rendering system makes SSR look like ray-tracing.
- Exceptional combat coupled with great time-warping abilities
- Captivating story and world-class voice-acting/motion-capture
- Most successful example of blending cinema with gaming in recent memory

Cons:
- Will DESTROY most modern computers.  Running on a 4090, I still dipped  below 30fps.  The game requires a tweak to remove unnecessary blurry anti-aliasing.  
- The story/exposition can drag. Some bad pacing issues. 
- Could've used a better progression/leveling up system; you basically get all abilities/weapons right off the bat.

185368635.review:
Firstly - my playtime is low because I ended up playing this through on XBOX Series X via backward compatibility (30fps 1440p experience unfortunately). The faff of getting this to work well in 2024 pushed me away from a PC playthrough. 

The steam version worked - but on the OLED steam deck the HDR was so aggressive that much of the scene was too poorly lit to play. None of the ingame controls or steam deck settings seemed to change this, so I decided that if I was going to play it at 30fps I may as well play it on a bigger TV. 

In contrast on the XBOX the lighting is non HDR aware - and everything seems in comparison to be TOO well lit - with odd the benefit of actually being able to see what the hell is going on.

The Windows version (included with Gamepass Ultimate on PC) is screwed beyond recognition - and under Win11 / DX12 is unplayable due to the lighting bugs. The screen fills with green and pink bloom - which makes me wonder how on earth Microsoft allows a first party title that you can download and play now to remain in this state.

The game itself is amazing. The mechanics and story are really good - and the time mechanics are really well done - although if you look at this as a prototype for Control then you wont be disappointed. 

If you want a headache free experience it pains me to say that you're far more likely to find it on XBOX as long as you're willing to accept 30fps (after a few minutes you forget about it altogether in my view).

185161020.review:
Narratively experimental Quantum Break is more a TV show than a game with 4 actual TV episodes interspersed. Such a structure requires strong writing, especially with a time travel theme, a genre that can often be bogged down by its premise and remove any sense of danger. Luckily Quantum Break succeeds in this department.

Characters in Quantum Break have a bold introduction as you play the role of Jack Joyce returning to his hometown after six years to meet up with an old friend, as you slowly waltz about the opening level examining all the fine details the depth and fullness of the world comes to focus, there is a care and attention to it that elevates the experience and doesn’t reveal too much but, has enough to keep you engaged. As it turns out a time machine is being shown to you and things go awry leading to time breaking and the core concept of the game, you getting time control powers, what follows is a story to fix time. Remembering key details as you play enriches the experience as the story is complete, everything has a purpose and will get at least somewhat of an answer if not a full one. Despite being a time travel story it keeps to a certain logic throughout which makes it possible to see where things are going and also makes the reveals exciting as you see if you were correct. It is one of a small number of time travel stories I enjoyed. It properly ramps up the stakes as you play and narrative choices impact the story in a very real and apparent way. All of this palls in comparison to the worldbuilding, reading, and listening to all the collectibles paints a full picture of the world and story, packing so much into just over 14 hours of playtime. The things you learn through the collectibles are a treat and feel real, some reveals are even teased through these and give much more context to the overall story, playing without it would feel incomplete.

Being a story centered around time leaves some creative options for both the soundtrack and the art style. While the soundtrack does feature several needle drops mainly between the acts which are well selected; it also features a score that has jarring noises and a more technical sound, it also flows and stutters with the time powers and freezes in the game making for a more immersive and connected experience. Similarly, the art style follows this idea, time-frozen things have a certain look to them taking into account light and sound. The geometric look things get creates an instantly memorable and noticeable effect making it clear the many times this happens, the powers themselves also take on unique looks that make it clear what they are doing. Despite this art style the game is plagued by some terrible graphical glitches, especially in the early game, it is to the point that it affects the ability to play the game as frequent black boxes or boxes of other colors would take the whole screen, this could be fixed by moving a bit and then changing some graphic settings around, and wasn’t nearly as persistent later in the game but the first half became an annoying experience as a result of this.

Unfortunately, Quantum Break is a game whose gameplay almost ruins the highs of its storytelling. As a third-person shooter, the guns control and feel awful to use, the accuracy and hitting are difficult to use to the point that it is easy to miss when you should be hitting enemies. Enemies also have a large amount of health that makes fights more tedious than anything, they get in the way of the story. While the time powers are cool and smooth out the gameplay, they also have some problems. Time Stop allows you to freeze time in a bubble to prevent enemies from moving and allows you to shoot bullets at it to stack and do extra damage when it’s unfrozen. This is a useful skill unfortunately it is rather difficult to aim and as a result, I would frequently miss it, this was frustrating and just led me not to use it often. Time Shield is a shield that stops and deflects bullets, this works well as a defensive move and is enjoyable to use. Time Blast is similar to Time Stop except it causes an explosion, this one is much easier for us as it has a visible indicator of where you place it, useful and fun. There are two movement abilities a blink and a dash, the dash is rather inconsistent requiring you to hold down shift, it has a sort of delay to it that makes it feel unintuitive and I would frequently use it for a short time and then it’d stop. It is perhaps down to Keyboard and Mouse but unfortunately, the combat was a mostly frustrating experience that deterred me from the game, while it has a cool concept only some of these were executed well.

It’s difficult to place Quantum Break, the story, world-building, music, and art style are well done. The story is especially well crafted and enjoyable but gameplay deters from it immensely. In the end, it is worth it for the awesome story though I’d play on easy and just try not to get too frustrated with the combat.
 
[h1]★★★☆☆[/h1]

184802034.review:
TLDR: I love the story in this game and the narrative choices, but this game drowns in the clear malicious apathy of the developers regarding gameplay. I strongly recommend playing on normal or lower so that this severe shortcoming does not harm your experience of the story.

==The following is a sad rant about the aforementioned malicious apathy of the developer. A truly unexpected experience from Remedy Entertainment.==

Following Act 1, I was certain that I was going to love this game and place it among my own hall-of-fame. Act 2 through 5 ensured that my initial opinion reversed.

This game has a good story with a wonderful way of presenting it. You will have to read and watch videos, a lot, but if you keep the game difficulty to normal or below, you will have a good time. Despite my negative experience, I continue to appreciate this aspect of the game.

The issues begin the second hard is chosen. Suddenly, what were minor inconveniences from what seemed merely poor design choices for gameplay rear their head as absolutely unacceptable. This becomes more readily apparent as significantly more environmental, spelling, and gameplay issues crop up as the story progresses. I believe this was a lack of play testing on release, but shows a malicious apathy that it is still present years later.

The most egregious issue arises due to how the developers implemented their cover mechanic. There is no way to disable this mechanic. It is automatic and instantly activates when the player approaches most objects. This mechanic has precedence over many choices the player can be attempting. The most significant one I ran into was trying to shoot right as the mechanic was activated. This results in the player's character being unable to shoot for seemingly forever. I eventually found a workaround where attempting to aim would re-enable the ability to shoot after a second. This is probably a result of how the cover mechanic works in this game, where one must aim to pop-up their head before shooting. This led to many scenarios where a close enemy I was going to kill shot me quite a few times instead. While it would be possible to shrug off damage received in these scenarios on normal or below, on hard this is rarely the case. I found myself avoiding anything that would activate the cover mechanic, as at least there are other mechanics to protect yourself without it. That the final boss battle is covered by so many objects that this is impossible felt like the final insult from the developer.

Beyond this horrifyingly badly implemented mechanic, there are other issues that are minor in comparison. First among them is the terrible performance of the game. With a 3080 at 1440p, I would regularly see short drops to 40 fps, and some more consistent drops to 60 fps (this is an 8 year old game). From others commentary online, the developers did not optimize this port from the console version. In fact, this game was apparently set around playing at 720p! What the actual hell!? An astounding choice for a AAA title. You get this experience too if you leave upscaling on in the game settings.

Next, as if to compound on the troubles of the cover mechanic lies some horrifying bad checkpoint placements. In one level, you can go through the first third, die, and start from the beginning. A specific trait of just this one level. On another, the entire last half of a level has no checkpoints until the end. Another specific choice not reflected anywhere else. I can only see this as resulting from malicious apathy, as it is impossible such a thing was not brought to the developer's attention after release.

Thirdly is the inconsistent implementation of the climbing mechanic. Some spots appear well adjusted, accounting for the many ways a player could choose to approach an object. Others required specific directions, which was only a minor inconvenience. Still others required a specific direction, at a specific location, that does not include being in contact with said object. Such inconsistency led to me abandoning this mechanic in firefights as well as a good deal of agony in platforming levels, one of which is the one that contains no checkpoints in the last half of it, as previously mentioned.

Other issues I ran into are:
-Spelling issues galore! For a game that wants you to read so much, this really should have been corrected.
-The game will change settings on you. I found graphics settings being toggled as well as difficulty, which was especially annoying as I was aiming for the hard difficulty achievement. The only way to correct the difficulty toggle was to replay all levels from before I noticed.
-More on the gameplay front, it is possible to shoot the npcs from complete cover. It seems the only requirement is that the player is able to place their reticle on the enemy, not that the player character's weapon is clear of the wall they are hiding behind. Considering how hacked together other gameplay elements are, I believe the third-person perspective was set by the developers as being the actual location for the weapon.
-Forced camera motions, sometimes during combat! What were they thinking!?

In summary, a well told story has been drowned by the malicious apathy of the developer regarding gameplay. Truly unfortunate.

It's a classic Remedy game. 
The storytelling and narrative are absolutely top notch. 
The player has many possibilities to influence the story, even combinations of decisions have an effect. 
The world offers many small details and if you read all the notes and hints, the world feels realistic. 
Gameplay-wise, however, it is lousy. Weapons all feel the same, fights are banal and uninteresting, jump passages are simple and puzzles are actually non-existent. Unless you are an achievement hunter set it to easy/normal and enjoy the story and world building. 
The game is short 8-10 hours to finish.

Buy it with a deep discount. 
Also, the TV episodes that run between chapters are streamed. Who knows how long they will be available.  Without these TV episodes you wouldn't understand the story of the game. On youtube there are theoretically 5-6 hours of video material to watch. 

TLDR:
Story/World: 8/10
Gameplay: 3/10

Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟 (4/5)
"Un mélange unique entre jeu vidéo et série télévisée, avec des moments mémorables et une histoire captivante."

Quantum Break, développé par Remedy Entertainment, est une œuvre audacieuse qui fusionne gameplay narratif et séquences télévisées en live-action. Ce titre ambitieux se distingue par sa narration axée sur les voyages temporels, ses graphismes impressionnants, et son gameplay mêlant action et manipulation du temps. Bien qu'il ne soit pas parfait, Quantum Break offre une expérience unique qui mérite d’être découverte.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Une histoire fascinante et bien construite : Quantum Break vous plonge dans une intrigue complexe où le temps s’effondre. Vous incarnez Jack Joyce, un héros malgré lui qui se retrouve doté de pouvoirs temporels après une expérience scientifique ratée. Les thèmes des paradoxes temporels, des trahisons et des choix moraux sont traités avec intelligence, et l’histoire reste captivante du début à la fin.

✅ Un mélange novateur entre jeu et série télévisée : Entre les chapitres jouables, le jeu inclut des épisodes en live-action qui approfondissent l’histoire et les personnages secondaires. Ces segments offrent un point de vue unique sur les événements et renforcent l’immersion dans cet univers.

✅ Des mécaniques de manipulation du temps spectaculaires : Le gameplay repose sur l’utilisation des pouvoirs temporels de Jack, comme figer les ennemis, esquiver les attaques à grande vitesse ou créer des boucliers temporels. Ces capacités rendent les combats dynamiques et incroyablement satisfaisants, surtout lorsqu’elles sont combinées avec un arsenal varié.

✅ Des graphismes et des animations impressionnants : Même des années après sa sortie, Quantum Break reste visuellement époustouflant. Les effets de distorsion temporelle, les environnements détaillés et les animations des personnages sont d’une qualité exceptionnelle.

✅ Une excellente performance des acteurs : Les performances de Shawn Ashmore (Jack Joyce) et Aidan Gillen (Paul Serene) ajoutent une profondeur émotionnelle aux personnages principaux. La modélisation des visages est également remarquable, renforçant l’impact des moments dramatiques.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Un gameplay parfois répétitif : Bien que les pouvoirs temporels soient amusants à utiliser, le jeu manque de variété dans les rencontres ennemies et les situations de combat. Cela peut donner une impression de répétition, surtout vers la fin.

⚠️ Les épisodes télévisés divisent : Si l’idée est novatrice, tout le monde n’appréciera pas de regarder de longs épisodes en plein milieu d’une partie. Bien qu’ils soient bien réalisés, leur rythme contraste avec l’action frénétique du gameplay et peut casser l’immersion pour certains joueurs.

⚠️ Un manque de rejouabilité : Bien que vos choix affectent certains aspects de l’histoire, leur impact reste limité. Cela réduit l’intérêt de refaire le jeu une fois terminé.

⚠️ Optimisation inégale sur PC : Lors de sa sortie, le jeu souffrait de problèmes de performances sur certaines configurations PC. Bien que des correctifs aient été apportés, quelques soucis subsistent, notamment en résolution 4K.

En conclusion :
Quantum Break est une expérience unique qui mélange action et narration de manière audacieuse. Sa combinaison de gameplay innovant et de séquences en live-action en fait un titre mémorable, malgré quelques défauts mineurs. Si vous aimez les jeux narratifs avec une touche de science-fiction, Quantum Break mérite votre attention.

🎮 Verdict final :
Un jeu captivant et visuellement impressionnant qui sort des sentiers battus. Si vous êtes prêt à accepter son rythme particulier, Quantum Break saura vous offrir une aventure inoubliable.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé : Environ 10 à 12 heures pour terminer l’histoire principale.
✨ Note personnelle : Une œuvre ambitieuse qui aurait mérité un peu plus de variété dans son gameplay, mais qui reste un must pour les amateurs de récits temporels. 🌌🕒

184231607.review:
Quantum Break is a unique blend of cinematic storytelling and third-person action, with a fascinating time-manipulation mechanic at its core. The game's narrative is ambitious, weaving a gripping story about time travel and its consequences, complemented by live-action episodes that deepen the plot. The visuals and performances are stellar, creating a memorable experience.

Achieving 100% completion is manageable, focusing on collectibles and unlocking upgrades rather than overly challenging tasks. It’s an enjoyable process that adds depth to the story without feeling tedious. I’d recommend it to fans of story-driven games who enjoy a mix of action and experimentation with time-based powers.

Rating: 8/10
While the gameplay might feel repetitive at times, the innovative storytelling and polished presentation make it stand out.

The game intersperses its chapters with live-action episodes that reflect the choices you make and the collectibles you’ve found in the game world. While this integration is innovative and adds depth to the narrative, the episodes can feel cool yet tedious at times, disrupting the flow of gameplay for some players.

了解这款游戏还是游戏刚出来看主播玩了知道的，17年打折入了玩过了一周目，但是当时电脑很垃圾，加上每章结束还得联网看美剧，卡的一比，体验真不能说好，最近更新了电脑配置就又把游戏下载下来补了全成就，这里综合这两段体验说一说这款游戏。

剧情的背景，基于时间破碎的基础概念来引申各个故事，我是比较喜欢的，毕竟算得上科幻的一种，但实际体验下来给我的感触却不是很深，整体剧情比较均衡，不能说好，也不能说不好，但每章的分支选择对后续的影响仅限于章节美剧以及收集品的不同，我不是很满意，感觉这个选择不如不做，对代入感的增加微乎其微。

游戏性上，流程中的一些解谜做得比较简单，基本上看一看就知道怎么过了。TPS战斗+时间技能还算可以，有一定的联动性，但在困难难度下敌人血厚伤害也高，还挺容易坐牢的，再加上某些时候非常逆天的存档点，点名最终战，死了还得过剧情，剧情跳过还得读个条，感觉这个读条跟我电脑的内存和SSD没一点关系，都很慢。

画面上，之前电脑不好的时候画面特效设置得比较低，感觉画面比较晃眼，且有很多时候有光污染的情况，最近玩画面特效都拉最高以后观感好了很多，但有一点我非常想吐槽，过场动画锁30帧，平常游玩170帧，而且偶尔在过场动画结束后，仍然锁定30帧，需要读一下档或者等一段时间才能好。
另外，最终战偶尔会有游戏直接闪退的情况（个人的电脑配置是AMD R9 9950x+NVIDIA 4080+64G内存），触发过两三次，查了一下发现也有朋友存在这个情况，但根本不知道为什么闪退，反正它就是闪退了。
只能说还得是老游戏，BUG根本不修的。

全成就整体不算很难，但需要耗费一定的时间，主要是困难模式通关相对麻烦一些，其他的基本上是剧情流程、战斗、收集等要素，我还想吐槽一下，为了做成就我开新游戏选了困难模式，前面玩得好好的，结果到了第三章突然变成普通模式，怎么调都调不到困难模式，不清楚是BUG还是因为我之前是简单模式通关的不给开，反正最后是通关后又从第三章开始打了一遍困难模式，让人摸不着头脑。

不过这款游戏还是可以一试的，原本价格不贵，如果有打折的话可以入手玩一玩，就当看了一部美剧。

184200595.review:
TL;DR: BUY ON DEEP SALE!!!

The most interesting part of this game, to me, is easily the combat/time powers. They're fun to use and its easy to see where Remedy's later game, Control (which is a much better game) took influences from. Control is a much more evolved and polished example of this supernatural psuedo-RPG action gameplay, though Quantum Break isn't exactly bad in this regard. 

My biggest issue was that I wanted MORE of the combat. But sadly the game is pretty short, 7 hours for me and about half of that was slow walk-and-talks, forced loss of control cutscenes, and weird live action films interspersing each chapter. I hated these for a variety of reasons. 

For one, its a lot of fluff that really doesn't matter too much. The game lets you make narrative choices, but they only change things in a very minor way. Not enough to make me care about replaying the game and trying out every possible choice combination since the ending is ultimately the same no matter what. The narrative isn't that complicated and you could honestly skip the little movies in between each act and get most of the story anyway. 

Which is probably what you'll be forced to do, since both the cutscenes and the films are painful to watch. Where the gameplay was smooth (albeit after fiddling with the graphical settings a bit) these where riddled with graphic issues like lines, visual "fuzz" discoloration, and more. Completely unwatchable even on modern hardware. 

On top of that, you've got what is basically your "modern streamlined AAA game" trappings designed to pad things out. Easy puzzles that don't offer much challenge and often get solved for you my voiceovers, collectibles, scripted boss mechanics, over-explain-ey dialogue, aforementioned slow walk and talks, etc. Also bugs. A lot of bugs. 

Perhaps if the narrative was more interesting I could recommend it. Instead I say get it on deep sale.

184117869.review:
A great scifi action game with Remedy's distinctive style (if you've played Alan Wake, this feels very similar despite having different themes). The graphics were ahead of their time and the overall level of detail in every aspect of Quantum Break is very impressive. The overall experience of this game felt a lot like a Hollywood action Scifi such as Minority Report. 

It's an easy recommendation for anyone who feels like a narrative action game that's pretty to look at. 

My only criticism of QB is that it gives me a slightly unsatisfying feeling that's hard to put my finger on. I actually got exactly the same feeling after finishing both Alan Wake games too, despite enjoying them a lot overall. Perhaps it's something to do with Remedy's storytelling style - there is always a lot of ambiguity and many questions left unanswered, so it's hard to get really interested in the narrative for me.

184096175.review:
[h3] Overall score: 6/10 [/h3]


This game very much feels like an underdeveloped sibling of titles such as [i]Control[/i] or [i]Detroit: Become Human[/i]. While it offers great acting and a good story with several well-thought-out decision points that greatly impact the narrative, the gameplay lacks optimisation and smooth execution.


[b] (+) Pros [/b]


- [i] Immersive Storytelling: [/i] The combination of gameplay & real live-action show is well executed and is the absolute highlight of the game. Even if a part of me wishes to play through the encounters that were "only" provided as a show, the combo works well to move the plot forward. Your decisions influence both the storyline and the characters, encouraging either overthinking or multiple playthroughs to explore every option. I absolutely loved the visual and mechanical representation of "time breaking down", truly captivating.
- [i] Compelling acting & characters: [/i] The acting part is a real highlight, whether in-game or in the show snippets accompanying the game. Actors make you care about the characters, which further supports immersion.
- [i] Difficulty settings & combat: [/i] Well-balanced difficulty levels, making the game accessible to both action-focused players and those sticking with it because of the story. The time powers you obtain add variety to the shooter gameplay and offer room to experiment.

[b] (-) Cons & nitpicks [/b]


- [i] Technical issues: [/i] Optimization is a major problem. For example, I had to disable anti-aliasing for half of the 5th arc to avoid the screen turning completely black. While this bug humorously fits the story as the "time was breaking down real bad at this point", it definitely made the experience less enjoyable.
- [i] Plot holes: [/i] Some character arcs feel underdeveloped, lacking either backstory or closure. E.g. the main protagonist is somehow a world-class marksman, but you have no clue how that is possible (since none of the powers you gain grant him this ability). The ominous Martin Hatch character seems to be at the centre of everything, however, nothing he does is ever explained by the game. 
- [i] Rough Combat: [/i] While the combat tries to be super dynamic, it occasionally fails at the execution. Certain abilities feel clunky to use, especially when aiming, and the character movement feels laggy at times - nothing major, but noticeable.

183969956.review:
Quantum Break es una obra maestra interactiva que redefine la narrativa en los videojuegos. Desarrollado por Remedy Entertainment, este título combina de manera magistral elementos de acción, ciencia ficción y drama, ofreciendo una experiencia única que trasciende las convenciones del medio.

El juego destaca por su innovador enfoque narrativo, que entrelaza segmentos jugables con episodios de una serie de televisión integrada, permitiendo que las decisiones del jugador influyan directamente en el desarrollo de la trama. Este formato híbrido no solo enriquece la historia, sino que también eleva la inmersión a un nivel sin precedentes.

La jugabilidad, centrada en la manipulación del tiempo, es tan innovadora como emocionante. Los poderes temporales del protagonista permiten enfrentamientos dinámicos y estratégicos, mientras que los entornos detallados y el diseño visual impecable crean un mundo cautivador.

Además, la calidad de las interpretaciones, encabezadas por un elenco de actores de renombre como Shawn Ashmore y Aidan Gillen, dota al juego de una profundidad emocional y realismo que rara vez se encuentra en este medio.

Recomiendo Quantum Break a aquellos que buscan una experiencia que combine narrativa profunda, acción trepidante y un enfoque audaz hacia la innovación en el entretenimiento interactivo. Es una prueba contundente del potencial de los videojuegos como forma de arte y como vehículo para contar historias memorables.

183583678.review:
[h1] RECOMENDO[/h1]

[b] Nota: [/b] ⭐⭐⭐⭐

[b][i]-Geral:[/i][/b]
Quantum Break me surpreendeu positivamente, especialmente na forma de contar sua história. A obra é realmente uma experiência artística, combinando episódios gravados por atores reais nas cinematics, o que ajuda na imersão. A ideia da trama envolvendo uma ficção sobre o tempo e como funcionaria uma viagem temporal. A premissa é realmente boa, e o jogo consegue ilustrar, de forma muito convincente, os impactos que a viagem no tempo poderia ter, caso fosse realmente possível. É interessante tambem algumas reviravoltas na narrativa ocasionadas pela viagem no tempo, faz com que a experiência seja envolvente. 

[b][i]-Gameplay:[/i][/b]
A jogabilidade é bem interessante. O jogo consegue oferecer uma variedade de poderes que podem ser utilizados de diferentes formas, o que permite ao jogador escolher o estilo de jogo que mais lhe agrada. Algumas pessoas consideram a jogabilidade repetitiva e afirma que ela tira o foco da narrativa, mas acho que essa critica não é totalmente justa, acho que eles separam bem o tiroteio e a historia, não senti que perdi nada por não ler os colecionais, por que afinal toda a historia é explicada a cada final de capitulo por meio das curtas-metragens. Essa interação de episódios  semelhante a uma séria exige que o jogador tenha um pouco mais de paciência. Existe momentos de ação, enquanto em outros, você se vê imerso em uma trama envolvente. 

Embora eu tenha enfrentado alguns bugs durante a jogatina, esses problemas foram, de certa forma, ''disfarçados'' pela própria mecânica de ruptura temporal do jogo.
